Kempe Project: East Harling, stained glass
<td colspan="2" align="left" valign="top"> <div align="left"> <table width="100%"  border="0">

In this 1480 stained glass panel (East Harling, Norfolk: East window, C2), the young Christ is seated on a high, throne-like seat in the top half of the composition, wearing a purple robe. The doctors are grouped round him, variously standing and sitting, and wearing some curious headgear. To the left stands the Virgin Mary, looking up in astonishment at her son who gazes back at his mother. The inscription at the top reads 'Docebat ihesus'.
